sourceDesc.p: Created from original research by members of CWRC/CSÉC unless otherwise noted.

div.head: ANDALVZIA
div.p: THis countrie hath on the eaſt ſyde Granda, on the weſt Algarbe, on the north the prouince called Magistratus S. Iacobi, & on the ſouth the ſtraight & begining of the Mediteraneum sea, comonly called the ſtraight of Gibraltar. On either ſyde this ſtraight are two moſte high mountaines, to wit, Gibraltar in Andaluzia whereof the ſtraight taketh name, & Abyla in Mauritania. Theſe two mountaines are of many called the columnes of Hercules, yet there are that affirme the columnes of Hercules to haue bin two pillers of braſſe in the tem- ple of Hercules, which was in the Ile of Gades, now called Cadiz or Cales in which they ſay was grauen the charges which the building of the ſaid temple did coſte, howbeit the certainty is altogether vncertaine, whether the two pillers of Hercules were theſe two mountaines, or two artificial pillers of braſſe.
This country of Andezulia is the moſte ferril parte of all Spaine, for aboun- dance of all ſortes of fruits & great plenty of other neceſſary thinges.
The inhabitants are courteous & ciuil, & very opulent. It is repleniſhed with almoſte 100 fyne townes, but the great & ritch citie of Siuil is the Chiefeſt citie of all this prouince.
The name it hath of Andezulia is growne but by corruption, for the right name is Vandaqulia, of the Vandales, that heere made there habitation, when by the Gubes they were chaſed out of other partes.
